description: Demolition of existing blocks at 56-71 Sunningdale Court and erection of a part 3, part 4-storey block containing 44 replacement flats for elderly residents, 14 car parking spaces, access and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Prior to the commencement of any development on site, soil samples shall be taken from the site at areas to be agreed by the council's Senior Environmental Health Officer, and submitted to the council in order to identify any problem areas of contamination, and to agree sufficient remediation to be carried out on site, which shall be implemented in accordance with agreed remediation.  REASON: In order to protect the health, well being and safety of future residents of the site, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to first occupation of the development, private garden areas shall have ground removed to a sufficient depth in order to allow only clean, natural or clean, imported soils in the upper 600mm, and soft landscaped areas elsewhere shall have ground removed to sufficient depth to allow only clean natural or clean imported soils in the upper 450mm.  The clean, natural or clean, imported soils shall be in place prior to first occupation.  REASON: In order to protect the health, well being and safety of future residents of the site, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including 4 new semi-mature street trees along Flemming Road, two trees on the west side of the building and 1 tree adjacent to the north-east boundary of the site where it adjoins the rear service road of Greenford Road properties, and including a phased programme of works, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  These works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, and in accordance with policy 4.5 of the Council's adopted UDP ' New Plan for the Environment 2004'. | No development shall take place until full details of measures to be taken to prevent damage to trees within the site in accordance BS 5837:2005 or whose root systems or canopies extend into the site during the construction process have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved.  Reason: To protect trees on site and the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the Councils adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment 2004'. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the building is occupied and retained thereafter.  Development shall be carried out and maintained in accordance with the approved details.   Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the Council's adopted UDP ' New Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Before the development is commenced, details of external lighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The lighting shall thereafter be provided and maintained solely in accordance with the approved details.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policy 4.12 of the Council's adopted UDP ' New Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Prior to the commencement of development on site, details of a privacy screen to prevent the loss of privacy between users of the proposed roof terrace area and residents living in houses on Greenford Road, to the north of the terrace, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the development shall be completed and permanently retained in accordance with such details.  REASON: In order to protect the privacy of surrounding residents in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The refuse bin stores shown on the approved drawings shall be provided before commencement of the use and thereafter retained for the duration of the use.  Reason: To ensure that adequate provision for refuse storage is made within the site, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies 4.1. | The developer shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design'.  Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements as detailed by the Government Circular 5/94 'Planning Out Crime' and with requirements of clause 17 of the Crime and disorder Act 1988 which imposes a duty on a Local Authority 'to do all that it can to prevent crime and disorder in its area' in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance note 8 'Safer Ealing'. | The car parking spaces on the approved site plan A4240/2.1/01B shall be marked out on site prior to first occupation of each phase of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.   Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision of car parking within the site, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy 9.1. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of works. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy 5.3. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, residential accommodation shall be constructed to include at least 10% of the units as wheelchair accessible, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON: To ensure that an adequate proportion of units is wheelchair accessible in accordance Policy 5.3 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'.
